intro: Kralikia myriocephala, commonly known as the many-headed kralikia, is a unique flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, spherical inflorescence composed of numerous small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed, providing a distinctive appearance. Kralikia myriocephala is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in high-altitude environments.
